description: This watering hole has been drawing jazz fans since it first opened in 1951. Admittedly the decor hasn't changed much since the old days, but the sounds you'll find here are cutting edge. The Rex lures top local and international talent; Tuesday is the weekly jam night.

reviews.title: Awesome jazz, good food!
text: We were two couples from North Carolina and Munich visiting TO for the first time. We seek live music everywhere we go and were not disappointed at The Rex. The atmosphere was just right, awesome jazz and good burgers. We highly recommend The Rex Jazz and Blues Bar!

reviews.title: Jazz Night at the Heart of Toronto
text: The Rex Hotel Jazz and Blues Bar are located at the heart of Toronto Downtown. This place defines a 'cozy place.' The music started at 8.30 PM, as they mentioned on the ticket.  We bought a ticket for Roberto Occhipinti Quartet. We preferred to sit in the bar section, which was very influential in comparing the price and quality.  I can suggest buying a ticket from the bar section if you like. You can see the main scene, don't worry. To have the best personal music listening experience, I suggest going with a maximum of 2 people. You can even feel meditating on the music while you go alone and sip your drink. Rex Jazz and Blues Bar are highly recommended for a relaxing night experience. Prices are fair; you must wait a while to deliver your order. That is the only negative side‚Äîoverall good experience.

reviews.title: The Rex, home of the service charge.
text: Take your business elsewhere, there is a $4 fee for tickets online as well as in person.

You can purchase tickets for Rex shows online at therex.ca  Each ticket is charged an additional $4 fee; 1 ticket + $4, 6 tickets + $24. The more tickets you buy the higher the (Shopify) fee. A bit steep if you compare it to the typical online flat rate booking fee per reservation vs per ticket.

You can purchase tickets in person at their Queen St West location... sort of. Ask at the door and you‚Äôll be directed next door to the Rex Hotel Reception. Rex staff will tell you can order online‚Ä¶ or they can purchase them online but it takes a lot of time‚Ä¶ i.e. staff understand that the inperson purchase is the same as online. To be clear, there is no debit card system, cash option or other acceptable in person payment system. All ticket purchases ‚Äúin person‚Äù go through Shopify and you‚Äôll be charged the additional $4 fee per ticket.
One wonders why they bother to even have a reception, there is no value to the customer and unfortunately no way to avoid ‚Äúon-line‚Äù service fees.
Until the Rex changes their policy, I‚Äôll be listening to live Jazz elsewhere.

reviews.title: Great Music, Rex surprised me
text: Great musicians. Expontaneous and the staff as well, wonderful everything. Have a good amount of drinks option. Very surprised by the gents that was playing, giving their best on the stage. Congrats!

reviews.title: Grand place to stay
text: Great location for a stay over, not expensive, staff were great and super helpful.  Food was fantastic, music was grand too. Only down side was no lift, BUT there are only two floors.

reviews.title: You have to be there
text: We really liked the music , outstanding! The entrance staff polite and helpful . Burgers were praised by our Torontonian friends as: thick, delicious and home made.Mine was thick , looked homemade but lacked flavor,.. it was bland. Our waitress nice, but seemed a bit distracted hence she didn't show up with the box for to go after 30 minutes we asked her.Doesn't matter , great experience we would go back.

reviews.title: Amazing night with live jazz and good food.
text: I brought my son as he loves jazz. There were two groups playing this night, both were incredible. The food was good, traditional pub fare but well prepared and quick to the table. We was Hannah Barstow and her quartet. She is amazing. She will have a long and successful career in the jazz world for sure. Gave me chills listening to her. If you like jazz, you have to go to the Rex. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

reviews.title: a lazy sunday afternoon
text: we spent a few days in Toronto. a highlight of our time in Toronto, was our visit to the Rex Jazz and Blues Bar. they seem to run continuous show with different styles of both jazz and blues. the bar is a mash up of wall decorations and  a mix of unmatched tables and chairs. funky would be an apt description. but dont let the looks deceive you. the beer selection is very good and although we didnt have anything to eat, customers were voicing their pleasure. mixed drinks were done well and strong. the music is absolutely solid. we watched Dr. Nick and the Rollercoasters play a full throated chicago  style blues to an appreciative audience. most shows are without any cover charge but be prepared to be generous when the tip jar is passed around. we thoroughly enjoyed kicking back on a cold sunday afternoon listening to some good music, drinking some tasty brews and sharing the setting with a great audience. on our next visit to toronto, we will definitely be coming back

reviews.title: Bangin
text: Did not know what to expect, but wow the place has loads of character and the music was fantastic, saw two different bands and there was no cover charge, however you were asked for donations
The bands were both on üî• fire and if I come back to Toronto again I will definitely be calling in

reviews.title: It's the Best!
text: We visited on a Saturday night. The place was packed! Grabbed one of the two empty tables closest to the stage (you seat yourselves) while the pedal steels band "the Neon Eagles" were setting up for their performance. People were still walking in and soon there was only standing room. Despite the busy-ness and little room between tables, our server was fast and friendly. The music was fantastic and the food wasn't anything less! We had club/grilled tofu sandwiches and  steak/veggie burgers, all came with fries, very reasonably prized. There was no cover fee for the performance we saw but we were very willing to contribute to their tip jar. Will definitely go back in the future!

reviews.title: Great fun and music
text: Great jazz with no cover charge ‚Äî can‚Äôt go wrong with that!  The food was good too (better than 99% of jazz venues). We went early - they have a 6:30 set, would like to go back to see more live music here. Very cool venue.

reviews.title: Great place with awsome live jazz music
text: We visited the bar during the Toronto jazz festival. A really nice place withe great live  music and atmosphere. Worth visiting for all jazz music lovers.

reviews.title: Cool place with lots of Character
text: Came to Toronto for a Rotary Convention and decided to get a bite in a place with some character and maybe some live music. After googling and calling to see if we needed a reservation (which is not needed) we decided to head up there.
We were not disappointed!  Luckily our visit was on a good weather day (apparently unusual for Toronto even in June) so we got to sit outside.

We were attended to right away. Our waitress was very attentive and the staff was genuinely friendly. There was a band playing when we got there, but later took a break ‚Äî There are a couple of different sessions per night.
Overall atmosphere was great, we had a great time and it‚Äôs a place that I would highly recommend when in Toronto.

reviews.title: One of the best Jazz and Blues bars in Toronto!
text: A Jazz institution for years in Toronto.

We went twice in a week. Heard Justin Bacchus on a Saturday night and then Chuck Jackson‚Äôs Big Bad Blues band last Friday!  He was one of the founders of Downchild Blues Band. Loved the music. Only wish they had space for some dancing!  Good wait staff,  fair drink prices. Haven‚Äôt eaten there but decent pub food that we‚Äôd seen. Recommend the place if you like good music.

reviews.title: Wow what a place
text: Music is excellent with a great selection. Amazing patio great for all type of meet ups and hook ups. I‚Äôm a see the food is good staff is fantastic you got to go. Michael

reviews.title: Ok but Carma and Acoustics (-)
text: Tables and chairs are not comfortable really- more like an old style cantina. Beverages & food was fine that night. Acoustics isn‚Äôt that good and worth improving. Nice bands played that night.

reviews.title: Mediocre food but nice atmosphere
text: You can overlook the food dud to the venue. It does not look like much from the outside, but it is a great venue inside.

reviews.title: gem on queen street
text: The Rex hotel has lots to offer, location: only a few blocks walk from the train station, Eton center, and lots of coffee shops and restaurants. Friendly and efficient staff, rooms that are in good shape although somewhat small. Great music and atmosphere

reviews.title: Great jazz scene.
text: This is a place where you can sit and have a drink and/or food and listen to great music at the same time.
The University of Toronto students big band was performing the night we were there and treated us to a great set. The individual soloists were of a high standard.
This is obviously a serious jazz bar, and it is always nice to see the performers get a good reception, and not just playing to a crowd treating it just as background music.

reviews.title: Decent food and great music
text: We've stayed at the hotel above the bar and naturally visited the bar for some food, drinks and live music. Great bands play here even several times a day. Food is decent and beer is cold.

reviews.title: Fabulous! Mark Eisenman Quintet
text: A night out to listen to Mark and his Quintet was well worth the 40 km drive. Sat front row, ate a Rex burger, excellent conversation, felt transposed, a million miles away from everything and sitting exactly where I wanted to be. Nothing like their live sounds. Hum! Why did I wait so long to treat myself to an incredible night out?

reviews.title: Super enjoyable casual venue for live jazz and blues
text: Got there around 8pm to catch a great show....walkable from the downtown hotels (we stayed at Hilton Toronto downtown).No cover for the early set which was nice but they do pass a tip jar so be prepared with smaller bills. Everyone around us ordered the nachos and they looked very good however we didn't order food. The bouncer was very nice and helpful and the waitress handled the crowd like a pro. Just an FYI you will be charged a cover for the later set if you choose to stay unlike the bars at home...once you're in you're in. Enjoy!!

reviews.title: What a great find!
text: My friend found The Rex on Instagram and we noticed it through the cold rain as we headed to Graffiti Alley last Saturday afternoon. Luckily we found out they have excellent live jazz Saturday afternoons so as we came in from the rain around 4 pm they had a great band playing with standing room only. We were fortunate to end up sitting next to the trumpet players parents once a seat opened up. We all agreed that not having to stay up until midnight to hear great jazz made this a true find!

reviews.title: Great music, pretty good nachos.
text: This really is the place to go in Toronto to hear live jazz.  Good atmosphere, find sound system, and the food is reasonable priced.  Not a huge assortment of craft beers---but we were able to find something we all liked and had a pitcher.

Music wise I liked the fact that they are willing to book groups who aren't necessarily playing your standard bebop or old standards style jazz.   They have quite a variety, and this wonderful group (Neon Eagle) was led by a pedal steel guitarist (Mike Eckert) of all people.    And they were terrific!
I'll be back!

reviews.title: Straight ahead jazz, casual vibe, killer classic cocktails
text: The Rex is the real deal. We were there for an early evening set (no cover) by a straight ahead alto player and her quartet. The jazz was real, the place was full, the vibe was great. It is roughly divided into two areas, one for the live music and one a bit farther back. We grabbed a couple of seats, ordered Old Fashioneds, and settled in for some good music. They have a food menu as well, but we had reservations around the corner at another place so we didn't eat anything. Looked and smelled pretty good,though.

reviews.title: Great
text: Wife stayed here for a few nights and really enjoyed it. The bar is good and the food and music is efficient and friendly. Would stay and visit again.

reviews.title: We changed our itinerary so that we could come back again
text: We dropped in by chance during our stay in Toronto. After a look at their program we knew immediately that they had such a great selection of shows that we had to come back! We rearranged our 3-week-long Canada-the-East itinerary, so that we could come back for another show a week later. If you like Jazz you have to visit the Rex! Great atmosphere, great beer, nice people, great shows. What else could you ask for?

reviews.title: Quick, easy breakfast
text: Found it by recommendation from another local eatery. Quick service. Friendly staff. Decent food. Thanks.

reviews.title: Rex Hotel Jazz and Blues Bar, center of the heart of Toronto
text: I was on my way home after visiting Canada inland when any opportunity came along when I had to staying over one night in Toronto. Looking for a budget hotel- cheap but good - located at the center of the city of Toronto, my eye was caught to the Rex  Hotel. The Hotel that just steps from Osgood subway station seems easily to find from Toronto International Airport. Staying here give one night incredible experience about Toronto at glance because almost all city's icons are reachable by foot from the hotel.Toronto looks so easy and cheap to be embraced for a while when you stay here.

reviews.title: The service is very poor.
text: The staff walks around the place like zombies, no warmth or friendliness.  You get the impression they want the customers to go away.  Service is very slow.  They claim they are "busy"  but they find time to go for walks outside instead of serving customers.

reviews.title: Great music and atmosphere
text: There is great music here all the time. Not just any musicians, but very accomplished ones. It is very cozy, the clientele is mature and responsive to the music. Service is great and food is quite good, especially the hamburger with Swiss cheese and mushrooms. It is easily accessible as well. Uncle Bass was fun and today, Tyler Yurima was at the keyboard. A real treat!!

reviews.title: Under Old Management
text: Great place, live music every day of the week, even get breakfast there. Food is nice and homely.  They have had the same management since 1951, great friendly staff and atmosphere. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Music stopped after 20 mins
text: We called earlier in day to see when music would stop. Told 1200 or later. We arrived way before music was to end. After 20 mins of taking the door fee, music stopped. Noted this to door person who was counting the cash. No return of funds. He just said they finished early. I am sure this is a great spot just not ok to take door money and music ends soon after arriving. Nothing else going on when music is done. Closed sign goes on. Food was good. Service friendly but kinda turned off from the experience!

reviews.title: Patio and indoor visit
text: The service was great. Very friendly. She didn't mind that we moved a couple of times on the patio so we could stay out of the sun. The indoor atmosphere with bands was also good. Wide variety of pub food on the menu - nothing special but fill the belly ! Get the portabello mushroom burger. Would go again to this Toronto classic

reviews.title: nice music and good food
text: nice music and good food, go on student night there is great music talent, nice selection of beers and table snack food, breakfasts also good

reviews.title: Great vibe here for music, food and brews
text: Great spot of great jazz..several vegetation options on the menu so we also ate here..it‚Äôs a popular spot so get here early if you want a see to see the bands. we enjoyed three sets of music by local college kids on a Monday night. Totally great.

reviews.title: Great atmosphere
text: Stopped in for supper snack before attending a show. It was a Wednesday and a special was Montreal Smoked Meat sandwich with fries and slaw. A good choice and we weren't disappointed. Good quantity and good quality. Very friendly wait staff. Great selection of drinks.Loved the atmosphere and the jazz/blues being played....we intend on returning to watch some live entertainment.
I think this could become a favourite of ours.

reviews.title: Good jazz, beer and burger
text: The place is great for listening local bands for jazz and blues, beer is really good quality and price. The house burger is delicious!

reviews.title: Evening Entertainment
text: What a great place to spend an evening, good music, Great selection of drinks, decent variety of food, Pleasant and helpful Staff! If Jazz/Blues is your preference I recommend a visit

reviews.title: Jazz , beer and burgers
text: Great night out. Went along to early evening show.  No cover charge but customary to tip the band a few dollars which they fully deserved. $15 for second show and well worth it too. Rex Signature burger went down very well with the beer and  top notch Jazz.  They tell me this place is an institution so wait you waiting for? Do It !!
